data.title: Not a kid friendly place or friendly place for adults as well
data.text: One day I met a friend in Downtown Mansfield and we took our kids in to get a cupcake. We hoped to support our locals. The owner was very rude and didn't like it one bit that we were taking her from decorating a cake. She seemed way to busy to help us and offered very little to choose from. I have not visited since and do not plan on ever. There are a ton of other places to get great cupcakes.

data.title: Hit or Miss
data.text: This place is hit or miss, but when it's a hit it is awesome. I had a friend bring  a mixture of cupcakes to a get together and they were truly awesome! I decided to pick some up for my family a week later. I checked their website for hours and headed out to pick some up. They were closed when they said they would be open. A couple of weeks later we went to the downtown Mansfield's German fest and they were open. I bought a Wedding Cake cupcake and it was the worst. It was so stale! I would give it a try once, but doubt that I will go out of my way to buy any again.

data.title: Just average..Nothing spectacular..
data.text: Love supporting local businesses and so our most recent sweet tooth led us to Frosted Pink to sample some treats..Very cute set up and counter staff was knowledgeable. Unfortunately every flavor we tried had a grainy cake..Wedding cake was the favorite over all but nothing spectacular.The red velvet was a disappointment. The cake/cupcakes at the counter were not refrigerated and the icing was sliding off of almost everything which made them not look very appetizing.That was a big factor considering its almost 100 degrees out. We will probably be giving them a second try. Hopefully they will have refrigerated cases by then.

data.title: Beautiful Cakes
data.text: I needed a wedding cake in a hurry!  My daughter decided to elope.   I went online and saw a beautiful cake displayed on their web page.   I called and asked if they could replicate it for me quickly and they agreed.  It was wonderful.  It tasted great too.

data.title: Do not waste your money
data.text: Purchased 12 cupcakes for $38.00. When I got there I noticed the cupcakes in the case had icing that was falling off. By the time I got home mine had done the same thing. I had to scoop the icing and place them back on top of the cupcake. When we ate them 3 hours later the icing was hard and the actual cupcake tasted funny. I called to talk to Tonya and she told me that once it leaves their facility there is nothing they can do but apologize. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!

data.title: Mmmm,cupcakes
data.text: Fantastic bakery, prefect for any special occasions or to just indulge your sweet tooth.My favorite is the red velvet cupcakes

data.title: Avoid
data.text: Ordered a birthday cake.  Fondant work was very sloppy.  Owner is very impatient and not a happy person.  Would not go there again

data.title: Tasty Cakes
data.text: With a variety of flavors and very moist cakes, I think you'll love these cupcakes.  They are great for parties and gifts.

data.title: Ghost Town Service
data.text: I stopped by this cute cowtown location, but there wasn't a soul in sight in the middle of the afternoon (08/12/15). Initially, I was going to order my daughter's birthday cake there, but I lost trust when no one was behind the counter.

data.title: nothing special, overpriced
data.text: too much icing, cake part tastes like it came from a cake mix, customer service was poor , way too expensive

data.title: Too sweet and poor customer service
data.text:
Purchased a cake for my daughters 9th birthday. My spouse purchased a cake for my stepson a few years ago from here and seemed pleased. When I went to pick up the cake the owner was talking to a friend customer about personal thinks and totally ignored my presence of coming into the store. I was so upset I would have left the place and bought a cake from SAMs club. But I already paid for the cake. After about 15 minutes of standing there. She finally felt the need to ask if I needed something. 

The butterfly cake I purchased was as expected. However, it was so sweet the kids wouldn't eat it. If you order here have your spouse or man friend go pick up the cake. They will get better customer service.

data.title: Not a fan
data.text: I will start this off by saying I do not like cream cheese frosting and this place does not offer any buttercream options. To be honest though I just wasn't impressed with the cupcakes either.

data.title: Bad Service
data.text: I ordered minnie birthday cookies for my daughters 1st birthday party. They were mickey mouse shaped with icing and a 1 and her name on them. I picked them up. They had gum paste on them and her name was spelt wrong. I asked for the order sheet to make sure it had the correct spelling. And it did. So she didn't even pay attention. And not to mention the cookies looked completely rushed and her name was written in a marker not in icing like the picture I have her. Said she would give credit and never did.  Do not shop here.

data.title: Rude Service and just ok cupcakes.
data.text: The owner is soooo RUDE. She walks around like someone did something to her. She doesn't even acknowledge her customers and the desserts are TOOOOOO SWEET.  UGH! STAY AWAY.

data.title: Rude service and outright fraud!
data.text: I purchased a custom monsters Inc. cake from this company which my friend picked up for me (she actually had the NERVE to post a picture of it on Facebook like she's proud of herself). I paid $110 for this cake which I bought for my sons first birthday party. $40 of that price was meant to be the cost of 2 FONDANT figurines at $20 a piece that she was supposed to make. When the cake was picked up there were these two cheap plastic toys where the fondant figurines were supposed to be. The owner of the company said NOTHING about it to my friend who picked up the cake - not even so much as an apology or explanation - nor did she call me AT ANY TIME to discuss an issue with making the fondant figurines and to see if there was anything that could be done or to offer me a partial refund since she was not going to make the fondant figurines. When I saw the cake and called her LIVID she actually defended her actions saying that that had "tried to make the fondant figurines, but that they didn't like the way they turned out so they bought these instead. (MEANWHILE SHE IS POSTING PICTURE AFTER PICTURE OF CAKES WITH PERFECT FONDANT FIGURINES - YOU CANT CONVINCE ME SHE COULD NOT PRODUCE SOMETHING AS SIMPLE AS A FONDANT MIKE WAZOWSKI!!!! - my guess is she ran out of time - forgot or just couldn't have been bothered) And since the contract says that they could take 'artistic liberties' that there was actually no problem charging me $40 for these two cheap plastic toys". I MEAN WHAT?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?! I explained to her that 'artistic liberties' does not mean you get to charge me exorbitant amounts of money for cheap toys (which sounds more like FRAUD to me) at which point she offered me STORE CREDIT for the difference. At first she offered me $15 back on the $40 I paid explaining that her store policy was no refunds. After I explained that she failed to deliver the product that I paid for she then offered me $20. Long story short I ended up getting only a $20 refund. ALSO I ordered an eyeball cupcake which was supposed to me made with ICING not fondant. I explained to her at the time of purchase that it would be my sons smash cake and that I didn't think he would enjoy the taste of fondant - the cupcake came with a thick layer of fondant and was dry and flavorless. Moms know that the smash cake is a HUGE deal for a first birthday party and this one will forever be ruined...on top of that the lady absolutely did not care one bit that I was not happy nor did she at any time admit that what she did was unethical or in any way wrong. I think the only reason she even gave me back the $20 that she did was because she wanted me off the phone. At the end of the day while the cake overall was cute it certainly is not worth the $90 that I ended up paying!!! DO NOT SHOP HERE!!!

data.title: Yummy!
data.text:
I've been going to this place since it opened and watched it grow.  The Lemon cupcake is my absolute favorite, but so are the Red Velvet, Strawberry and Chocolate Chocolate.  Brownies were recently added to the menu and like the cupcakes, very moist.  There are rotating flavors that include Candy Bar, Maple Bacon, Wedding Cake, etc, but I always return to my faves.  She also serves Chocolate Amaretto and Amaretto cakes daily.   They are really moist.  Whoopee Pies, Cake Pops and Cake Truffles are also available.  The first two are too sweet for my taste (I take 1/2 the frosting off my cupcake even though it's fabulous), but if you love frosting, you'll love these.  The Truffles are fabulous, but she recently started making them a little too small which is probably a good thing for some of us.

The owner goes out of her way to take care of repeat customers.  I've tried cupcakes all over the Mansfield/Arlington area and her's are the best.  Most never made me want to go out of my way to get them, but I'll gladly make a detour or special trip to Frosted Pink.  My office loves them, too!

data.title: NOTHING GOOD ABOUT THIS PLACE
data.text: Unfriendly and way too expensive for such dry, tasteless cupcakes that weren't the ones that I ordered ahead of time anyway.  I'll never, ever go back!
